page.title: 13Climate, Craignish.
page.content: Our Winters are not as severe as in some areas of Scotland but it is possible to get icy road conditions from November onward.An extremely hard frost early this year froze filters at Loch Fada and the village was without mains water for many hours! We usually have at least a little snow(some years worse than others) but it is rare that roads become blocked by snowfall. However, when gales strike we some- times get roads blocked by fallen trees & power & telephone lines down. Rainfall (recorded 7 miles away at Kilmartin) for the 4 yrs '81-'84 gives an annual average of 1580.275mm. The greatest monthly fall 296.4mm (Oct 83) least 14.5mm(May 84). We do get 'good' weather,particularly May/early Autumn, but high humidity brings the scourge of the West Coast:- the dreaded midge! We get some fine, clear starry nights.
